Families in the highlands implemented

Two crew members stranded on Bon
Tong and drifting in the waters of Thua
Thien Hue were promptly rescued by the ship
and brought ashore safely yesterday afternoon.
Thua Thien Que Maritime Police
said that on the afternoon of November 13, the unit
received news from the
Region 2 Maritime Search and Rescue Coordination Center that two crew
members were in distress at sea early yesterday morning
on the fishing vessel BD 94404.  TF S took along
two suddenly broken corrugated iron sheets. When the ship
anchored, a corrugated iron sheet broke off and floated
away. Two crew members received
information about search and rescue plans that
had been coordinated by the units.  Deploying
maritime deterrence, Thien Que
contacted and requested the Hoang Sa 126 ship passing
through the area to change course
to search for the crew members until 13:00 on the
same day the Hoang Sa 126 ship.
The crew member in distress was brought to
Chan May port and handed over to the border station
, including two crew members, Mr. Le,
35 years old, and Mr. Tuan, 39 years old, both from Ca
Mau, whose health is now
stable. Moving on to other information at
Ho Chi Minh City has spent nearly 2 years
implementing a community health development project
to care for and improve people's health.
Although the city has paid a lot of
attention, the number of medical staff quitting their
jobs during this time has increased.  The past rate is still increasing rapidly,
this shows that there is a need to immediately take
more practical measures to solve
this situation.
Thu Duc city hospital has nearly 1,600
employees daily, receiving about
4,500 people for examination and treatment.
It's a very big job, but the
compensation and benefits are not adequate, causing many
workers to leave. During a
normal night of duty, they only get around under
100,000 VND per night of duty. I think it's
not worth the
professional effort that you put in.  In just
October 2023, the city had a
total of 142 medical staff quitting their jobs.
Recruiting and retaining workers
is facing many difficulties, with 13
doctors working in 12 states in the city.
Meanwhile, two doctors will return next year
and be recruited continuously, but
no doctor will come to work at the
Center to find solutions to ensure
human resources for the health sector that the
city government cares about.  The key point lies
in the salary policy.
In addition to the proposal to deduct
salary reform to increase income for
medical staff, the Ho Chi Minh City Department of Health
also proposed to set a timeline.
Minimum basic medical service for
newly graduated doctors

to prepare carefully to respond in all

C3 medical center is located  Renovated from the

and 100 beds, including 20

No one wants a prolonged war, but
we must prepare an
underground hospital to ensure treatment
and surgery for patients in
any circumstances since the
Israel-Hamas conflict broke out.  C3 medical center has

Down Airport in New York, USA. This is the

this city, this aircraft operates
entirely on electric batteries. It is the first air taxi
in the world. Its outstanding advantage
is that it flies away from urban routes without
creating emissions and loud noise like
helicopters.  The plane has a pilot and can carry
four passengers. Its speed is up
to 320 km/h, which means flying from Manhattan
to John F Kennedy International Airport

floating solar panels have
become popular to take advantage of
space on water to generate renewable energy
without using land.  The
potential consequences for the
underlying aquatic environment are still unclear.
A research team from Cornell University in
New York, USA, conducted a
study to examine this issue.
nearly 400 solar panels on three lakes
at the cornel research area they will
evaluate various factors including
greenhouse gas emissions summer algae growth
sounds and the
environment we are trying to better understand
What happens when you put
solar panels floating on
water? Shade increases.
How does this affect things like
aquatic plants, aquatic animals, and
greenhouse gas emissions?
Microorganisms and other types of organisms The
potential benefits of allowing
the deployment of floating solar panels
on federal storage facilities in the United States are
significant, according to the lawmakers who
proposed this plan.  can save
up to 2 million hectares of land and meet 10 minutes of
America's electricity demand. Professor Cross Sky
also emphasized the need for a
broad approach in the
renewable energy transition process to avoid
negative consequences.  Wishing for the
Future Today, the Korean Ministry of Transportation
banned all aircraft from taking off
and landing for about 40 minutes on
November 16 to ensure that
no disturbing noise is created.  For the
English listening test in the
annual national proficiency test, planes will
not be allowed to take off and land between
1:50 p.m. and 1:40 p.m. on
November 16. This is the period
when  Candidates taking the English listening test on
aircraft that are in operation
except in emergency situations must
fly in standby mode at an altitude of at least 3 km
above the ground. This decision leads to an
adjustment to the flight schedule.  94
airline flights will notify
passengers of this change in advance. This is an
important exam
in Korea because the exam results will be the
basis for students to choose a
university or college.  College opens up a path for
future careers. Not only
students but also parents often
feel a lot of pressure before

2017, the profession of raising Toad birds to catch fish has existed
for 1,300 years in Japan, but
has gradually declined until now there are only 48
people following this traditional profession,
similar to the Chinese profession of
bird fishing.  Coc is considered a local cultural heritage
and is very attractive to tourists,
but climate change is making
this unique profession more and more fragile
when night falls, which is also the time when E
scrub people in the province  The fisherman started
the fish yard, we lit a fire in front of
the sleeping fish boat, they would wake up and swim
wildly, the Cormorants would catch them on the bank of the
Nakara river to eat at night and watch people catch fish
which attracts many tourists to Ghi
Phu province.  However, climate change causes
heavy rains and frequent floods, and the
specialty fish stocks here are also less angry.
Research shows that algae in the water is becoming
less and less, algae that used to stick to rocks and make food
for bitter fish.  If the rocks are buried by sand, there will be
fewer bitter fish. The local government
has made many efforts to restore
this custom, such as building
high huts with machines and adding many types of
accompanying entertainment such as gyms or performances.  performing
traditional music, but that is only the
first step. The next step is to restore the
river flow to restore the bitter fish population so that at
night, the boats can continue to light fires
for cormorants to hunt fish and attract
tourists to the place.
This is good news for
Indonesia and the world's efforts to protect the ecosystem. A
Sumatran elephant is on the
red list of danger of extinction. Just gave
birth to an elephant. The
male elephant that was just born weighs about
108 kg.  The elephant has not yet been named and is
being given special care by a team of
staff and experts at the
Way Campus National Park in the south of Sumatra Island,
Indonesia. Currently, the elephant's health
is stable and the mother Elephant is in
constant health.  health monitoring Riska gave
birth to a female elephant in 2017.
Good news continuously came to the island of Sumatra.
Previously, a Sumatran rhinoceros, an
urgently protected species, was also
born in another national park on the island.
According to the international organization for nature conservation
wwf vo sumatra, there are only a maximum of 2,800
animals left

this morning a serious traffic accident
occurred in district m,
Dak Lak province, causing two deaths and three
injuries. Police are investigating the
cause of the
collision at 9:00 this morning.  A car with an unknown

26 in the direction from Dak Lak to Khanh Hoa.
When reaching the section passing MD Pass, Phuong Hoang Pass
in E commune, this car suddenly crashed into a
railing on the right side of the road.
Five people were hit so hard that
37-year-old Tran Quoc Cuong died on the spot
and 35-year-old Vo Van Quang died at the
emd district medical center. The remaining three victims,
Pham Hi Nhat Tien Nguyen, Dinh
Anh Tai, were seriously injured.  is being
treated at the hospital. Until this afternoon, the

clarify the
accident this morning on National Highway 1A, passing through

accident between a tractor-trailer and a motorbike.

The police and ranger district of Han Dat district
are consolidating documents to handle the
above subject for violating regulations on the
protection of endangered and rare animals. The subject
is Nguyen Van, born in the year
1968 met Cong commune, Tan Bien district,
Tay Ninh province. Early this morning, working group
108 of the Kien Giang province police, patrolling
Tien Rach Gia island, discovered a
car with suspicious signs and asked to stop for
inspection.  The police discovered that
there were 10 live long-tailed macaques in the car. The total
weight was about 20 kg. This was a long-tailed macaque
belonging to group 2B in the list of
rare and endangered forest animals, so the working group
made a record and handed it over to the police.  Hon
Dat district processed at the police station
to declare that the 10 long-tailed macaques mentioned
above were set up traps to catch them in Phu Quoc and then
brought to Tay Ninh to be boiled and sold on the
way. They were discovered and captured by the police.
